Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Troubleshooting, adjusting, and replacing AC and DC electrical equipment such as batteries, control stations, fuses, motor starters, relays, switches, timers, servo driven equipment, photo electrical devices, transducers, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD’s) and encoders

System/Project design, costing and implementation from concept to completion to include capital improvement programs. Job Title: EAM Regional Operations Eng., InfraOps Availability
Job Description:
3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.
Ability to follow accurate and complete support procedures, system documentation, and issue tracking entries.
Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time to other Regions to support EAM Rollouts across the globe.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.

It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. Perform repairs as needed in a timely manner. Follow all safety and environmental procedures at all times. Provide building system support for project work and construction projects as needed. Provide support for lab and pilot plant staffs as necessary. Available 24/7 to respond to the site for emergencies.

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Job Title: EAM Regional Operations Eng., InfraOps Availability
Job Description:
3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.
Ability to follow accurate and complete support procedures, system documentation, and issue tracking entries.
Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time to other Regions to support EAM Rollouts across the globe.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Job Title: EAM Regional Operations Eng., InfraOps Availability

3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.

Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

Job Description:

Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.

3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.

Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Job Title: EAM Regional Operations Eng., InfraOps Availability
Job Description:
3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.
Ability to follow accurate and complete support procedures, system documentation, and issue tracking entries.
Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time to other Regions to support EAM Rollouts across the globe.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment

What you do at AMD changes everything
At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.
Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.

Responsibilities

Operate and maintain HVAC, electrical, controls and plumbing systems R&D center physical plant that supports R&D pilot plant, laboratory and office space in a safe, effective and efficient manner. Perform repairs as needed in a timely manner. Follow all safety and environmental procedures at all times. Provide building system support for project work and construction projects as needed. Provide support for lab and pilot plant staffs as necessary. Available 24/7 to respond to the site for emergencies.

Principle Accountabilities
Operates building and site systems in a safe, efficient and effective manner.

Performs building tours to confirm systems operation and maintains records in computerized system.

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Troubleshooting, adjusting, and replacing AC and DC electrical equipment such as batteries, control stations, fuses, motor starters, relays, switches, timers, servo driven equipment, photo electrical devices, transducers, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD’s) and encoders

Job Title: Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career
Job Description:
COVID-19 continues to significantly impact our employees, families and communities. With employee health and safety as our top priority, and as a federal contractor, Lockheed Martin is taking action to address the increased risk and uncertainty COVID-19 variants pose in the workplace and ensuring we meet our commitments to national security.

To uphold safety for all employees, we will continue to request vaccination status for all Lockheed Martin employees including new hires. All current and newly hired employees are required to follow onsite safety measures based upon the COVID-19 Community Level at the specific work location.
Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work.

With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel development and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.

At Lockheed Martin, we place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering innovation, integrity, and exemplifying the epitome of corporate responsibility.

Your Mission is Ours.

Lockheed Martin Aeronautics in Fort Worth, TX is seeking a Flight Test Instrumentation Laboratory Eng (MS Degree) - Early Career). In this role, you will be responsible for: working as part of the engineering team that leads the lab which installs strain gages on Flight test articles, as well as F-35 production strain gages, and ground test gages; assisting with scheduling work coming through the lab and laying out work to be performed; coordination as part of a team with operational bases, depots, and flight test centers for repairs and/or installation of strain gages; the development and writing of material and process specifications for various Strain Gage or Temp Sensor applications; coordination with all Engineering disciplines affected by Strain Gage similar activities; providing information related to the reporting of issues and/or results to upper management and/or the customer; assisting in the development and overseeing the execution of Strain Gage installations and their interface with Flight Test and Ground Test data systems; willing to travel and support offsite repairs and installations of Strain Gages (Stateside and International). This position will also support the Instrumentation Engineering lab activities by: Assisting in Package Checkout activities across all programs within the IRAC Lab as required; Support the FTI Transducer Selection and Calibration operations in cooperation with the Metrology organization; Support configuration and development activities on IRAC Lab Computers, including configuration and SW development (LabVIEW) as required; Support configuration and troubleshooting of FTI Laptop computers as required.

Must be a US Citizen ; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.

Master's degree in Electrical Engineer
Knowledge of circuit design

Good oral and written communication
Good knowledge of Microsoft Suite
Familiarity with electronics components
Engineering Lab experience
Team Player

Job Title: Electrical Des Engineer II (Cabin - Seating ENG)
Job Description:
Job Summary: Development of electrical engineering design data within budget in accordance with FAA, customer and HAECO Cabin Solutions standards of quality.

Essential Job Duties:
1. Provide technical support and guidance to engineering personnel of various disciplines for engineering programs in which HAECO Cabin Solutions is involved. Assist and guide engineers in accomplishing designs.
2. Conduct detailed audits and surveys on site at customer facilities to develop aircraft design concepts and specifications through the interpretation of preliminary specifications and customer interface.
3. Research and review engineering data (drawings, reports, manuals, etc.) defining aircraft electrical / avionics systems in support of design work.
4. Support various design review meetings with customers.
5. Provide support during installation of modifications at remote locations.
6. Must be able to work on complex design tasks with limited assistance.
7. Check the design data produced by less experienced Design Engineers.
8. Assist with development of less experienced Design Engineers by acting as a mentor/resource.
9. Support, in a professional manner, customers, major manufacturers, vendors, FAA, or other outside agencies to promote and support HAECO Cabin Solutions technical & commercial interests.
10. Interface with the Substantiation group and ODA representatives to ensure that all designs meet the established FAA regulatory criteria.
11. Convert limited modification specification information into engineering design data for proper installation of aircraft electrical modifications and generation of cable/wire harness detail and assembly designs.
12. Develop preliminary engineering analysis necessary to substantiate aircraft electrical modifications.
13. Interface with other departments to ensure customer & HAECO Cabin Solutions requirements are met.
14. Provide technical support to HAECO Cabin Solutions Manufacturing during the manufacturing and installation phases of HAECO Cabin Solutions developed designs.
15. Provide input and suggestions for continuous improvement of various department procedures, controls, flows and systems, and become familiar with HAECO Cabin Solutions internal policies and procedures.


Perform other duties as assigned


Accountable to the Engineering Manager


Minimum
1. BS Degree in Engineering or related scientific field, or equivalent combination of experience and coursework.
2. Three (3) years industry experience in engineering field, preferably dealing in the design of modifications to transport category aircraft.
3. Minimum two (2) years experience utilizing AutoCAD (or comparable CAD program) with demonstrable proficiency.
4. Must possess some knowledge of FAA regulations, certification processes and related requirements.
5. Must possess knowledge of standard aircraft components, materials, fabrication practices, aviation hardware and proper application in design.
6. Must possess knowledge of engineering principles used in electrical design.
7. Must possess knowledge of personal computer systems with Microsoft Office.
8. Must have knowledge of the use and application of aircraft technical data such as engineering drawings, AMM’s, SB’s, IPC’s, WD’s, etc.
9. Must possess good oral, written, and organizational skills, and be able to read, write, speak and understand the English language.

Preferred
1. Masters Degree in Engineering.


1. Must possess ability to maneuver around airplanes (i.e. climbing stairs, on work stands, etc.) and in confined areas (i.e. cargo compartments, E/E bays, etc.).
2. Must also be able to lift and carry 15 lbs.
3. Must be able to sit and work effectively at a computer for extended periods of time.
4. Visual acuity must be minimum of 20/40 corrected.
5. Position may require travel both domestically and internationally.

Job Title: EAM Regional Operations Eng., InfraOps Availability
Job Description:
3+ years managing a CMMS system in a critical environment.
Ability to follow accurate and complete support procedures, system documentation, and issue tracking entries.
Technical Degree or equivalent professional experience in Engineering, Facilities Management, Analytics, Project Management, Computer Science or Information Technology.
Electrical, Mechanical, Systems & Facilities Engineering knowledge.
Ability to travel up to 20% of time to other Regions to support EAM Rollouts across the globe.

Job summary The EAM Team is looking for an Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) Regional Operations Engineer to support our data centers with asset management, maintenance tracking, maintenance scheduling and EAM system training. If you would like to deploy a Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to support our data center infrastructure, implement preventative maintenance programs, and innovate new solutions for Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing (MEP) systems then we'd like to meet you. As a gatekeeper for mission critical data your work will ensure our customer teams have the accurate data they need to improve Data Center availability through standardized and optimized maintenance management (a broad range of responsibilities, asset validation on site, identifying assets, working with end users to train and improve the system, understanding an optimizing work flows, a chance to work with SQL Server database query, BI reporting, software administration). Key job responsibilities As an EAM Regional Operations Engineer you will be required to deploy, maintain, and enhance EAM for the data centers which you are in charge of. These responsibilities include the following activities: • Ensuring asset data in EAM is accurate by physically validating the assets at the data center • Working with the operations team to schedule maintenance for all new equipment • Conducting monthly new hire training along with any other training as necessary • Acting as the EAM point of contact for the data centers for which you are responsible • Reporting performance analytics to operations managers • Requesting EAM updates and design changes to provide customer teams with the data they need • Supporting new site deployment of EAM A day in the life • Partnering with the operations team on maintenance and project • EAM Point of Contact for Data Centers • Reporting on performance analytics • Supporting new site deployment
